snippet: With more American students studying overseas, particularly in parts of the world with weak traffic-safety standard, parents and educators are on guard....
abstract: American students studying abroad are at risk of dying in road crash, leading cause of death for teens and young adults in nation and worldwide; academic and safety specialists worry toll will rise as number of American students studying abroad continues to grow, with many traveling to regions where road and vehicle maintenance and driving laws are lax; hazard has prompted safety initiatives, including proposed legislation.
lead_paragraph: With more American students studying overseas, particularly in parts of the world with weak traffic-safety standard, parents and educators are on guard.

headline.print_headline: Biggest Risk for Students Overseas: Road Deaths
headline.main: Study-Abroad Programs Address a Risk: Road Fatalities
